result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammy H Al Saadi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.
Shall complete counseling stared with Ms. Wagner
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Sammy H Al Saadi in court with attorney Ramneek S Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds victim rights compliant.  Defendant is contesting motion to revoke DPA.  Attorney Tienstra heard on violations with the DPA.  State is moving to revoke.  Attorney Button responds, indicates defendant was in counseling.    Discussion held.  Court grants request of Attorney Button to adjourn to obtain letter from counselor indicating defendant was in counseling during period of DPA.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 5, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Motion hearing scheduled for August 31, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

9:05 - Defendant, Sammy H Al Saadi in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Return date scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
